Number: Use place value to write and order numbers up to 100,000,000
Round numbers to a required degree of accuracy
Understand and use factors, multiples, primes, squares, and cubes
Use ratio and proportion to solve problems
Convert between fractions, decimals and percentages
Compare and order numbers including negatives and decimals
Algebra: Generate sequences and describe the rule
Geometry: Use properties and vocabulary of angles
Calculate angles in triangles, quadrilaterals, and circles
Reflect and translate shapes on a coordinate plane
Understand properties of parallel and perpendicular lines
Statistics: Collect, process and interpret statistical data
Use mean, median, mode, and range as measures of central tendency
Construct and interpret bar graphs, line graphs, pie charts
Understand probability as a measure of likelihood
Measurement: Convert metric units for length, mass, volume and area
Calculate perimeter and area for triangles, rectangles, and compound figures

Chemistry: Properties of solids, liquids and gases
Changes of state and particle theory
Mixtures and methods of separating substances
Physics: Forces and their effects (types, direction, magnitude)

Reading: Develop reading for comprehension and inference
Analyse language, structure and literary devices
Writing: Plan, draft and refine writing for a range of genres
Organise writing effectively using paragraphs and connectives
Employ accurate grammar and varied punctuation
Speaking and listening: Active and critical listening to others
